meanings.definition: To absorb or take in beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The sponge preabsorbs water before I even start cleaning.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel preabsorbs any spills quickly.
meanings.sent3: The plant preabsorbs all the sunlight, leaving none for the other plants!
meanings.sent4: Her mind preabsorbs knowledge like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The dry soil preabsorbs the rain, quenching its thirst instantly.

meanings.definition: To be absorbed or taken in beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The fabric preabsorbs the dye, ensuring a vibrant color.
meanings.sent2: The skin preabsorbs the lotion, keeping it moisturized all day.
meanings.sent3: The cake preabsorbs the icing, making it disappear before serving!
meanings.sent4: His words preabsorb my attention, leaving me hanging on every word.
meanings.sent5: The tree roots preabsorb nutrients from the soil, ensuring strong growth.
